data.title: Extension installed notification should have a Close action
data.body:
Related to #4024

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install a new extension -> get a notification
2. Notice that the notification does not have a close action
3. Most of our notifications have a Close action in the case that the user just wants to dismiss the notification. I would also expect a close action in this case - especailly since a Restart feels heavy and some users might not want to restart VSCode right away

![screen shot 2016-03-14 at 15 19 52](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/13747380/461d424a-e9f8-11e5-9900-14619479ea11.png)

while testing #4092

'Column select' mode shows selection with round corners. This looks somewhat like screen cheese:

data.title: NLS - Extension error messages are not localized
data.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/172399/13747035/a35e663e-e9f6-11e5-910e-d106473504a5.png)

There should be a translatable message that 'An extension could not be loaded', the exception detail doesn't have to be translated and can be in English.

There is limited space in the message control and this is another reason for #4112.

data.title: Closing window that was created with `-w` quits code in OS X
data.body:
Related to #4006

OS X
1. Quit Code
2. `code-alpha -w`
3. <kbd>Cmd W</kbd> to close the window

Code quits altogether, when it should still be running.

data.title: `-w` doesn't work when there are no windows open
data.body:
Related to #4006 

OS X
1. Open Code
2. Close all windows but make sure the app is still running
3. Run `code-alpha -w`

It returns immediately instead of waiting.

data.title: Remove the JS Salsa Migration message
data.body: The migration to Salsa took place in 0.10.10 and we now must remove the 'JS Infrastructure has changed hint'

data.title: NLS - InnoSetup is not localized
data.body:
- VSCode Version: alpha
- OS Version: Win
- Locale: German

Steps to Reproduce:
1. My labtop is set up for German and VS Code appears localized
2. When there is an auto update, I get prompted in German whether I want an update

`->` then the InnoSetup install dialogs show up in English since they are not localized.

data.title: Extension icon needs more UI love <3
data.body:
Related to #4024

The Extension icon that we currently use in the status bar needs more UI love. IMHO 'extension' is not the first word on top of the user's head when he sees that icon.

We will also make this icon even more prominant in the future since it we will probably add an extension viewlet and then it will be in the activity bar.
So creating this item now to start the thought process if we decide to change it.

ping @joaomoreno 

![screen shot 2016-03-14 at 15 02 00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/13746864/bc38af9e-e9f5-11e5-8da2-107c77ee82e4.png)

data.title: Deleting an extension does not give immediate user feedback
data.body:
Related to #4024
- VSCode Version: 18ebb4a4f5491af7b16e91e42fc36410bbb2e4d7
- OS Version: Linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open VSCode, install an extension
2. quick open > show installed extensions > click on the delete button to uninstall the extension
3. I do not get any feedback and quick open stays open, I only get notifications once I manually close the quick open
4. I would expect quick open gets closed once I click on uninstall and that I see notifications once the extension gets uninstalled

data.title: Improve diff editor title when comparing files
data.body:
Related to #3954

Maybe we could use the subtitle part to show the folders, like:

**tK4ZY9_monkey.txt ↔ monkey.txt** - /private/var/folders/lr/b36df5dx0y7cy_mywg5r623800000gn/T, /Users/joao/Work/fakeproject

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/13746374/740772e8-e9f3-11e5-8e16-6b6143bbb085.png)

data.title: Release note link does not respect vscode version
data.body:
Related to #4023

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open local storage and modify key `storage://global/releasenotes/lastversion` to an older version
2. Reload code - notice how we show the release notes popup, click on the 'Release Notes'
3. User is taken to the following link https://code.visualstudio.com/updates#vscode
4. I would expect that the release notes of the current vscode are shown - not the latest

The scenario where I see this happening is that we want to notify insiders what is updated in their update, so we change the https://code.visualstudio.com/updates#vscode, however now some user which is using stable is coming back from vacation and opens stable for the first time - he gets updated and gets the wrong release notes (the ones created for insiders).

data.title: `--wait` doesn't return when opening a new window and closing the first one
data.body:
Related to #4006

OS X
1. Close all Code instances
2. Run `code-alpha --wait monkey.txt`, do some changes, save
3. Open a new Window
4. Close the first one

I'd expect the command line to return after step 4.

data.title: Release notes notification show even if vscode downgrades to an older version
data.body:
related to #4023

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open local storage and modify key `storage://global/releasenotes/lastversion` to `1.0.0`
2. Reload code - notice how we show the release notes popup
3. I would not show the release notes in a scenario where we downgrade a VSCode version - as the user has probably already seen those release notes in the past

data.body:
When reproducing #4136, I immediately after get the following error in dev tools:

```
TypeError: Cannot convert object to primitive value
    at new Error (native)
    at Client.trackException (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Alpha.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/applicationinsights/Library/Client.js:67:25)
    at e.logException (file:////Applications/Visual Studio Code - Alpha.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:23:31729)
    at e.log (file:////Applications/Visual Studio Code - Alpha.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:113:16493)
    at t.handleEvent (file:////Applications/Visual Studio Code - Alpha.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:68:17513)
    at t.e.publicLog (file:////Applications/Visual Studio Code - Alpha.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:68:14698)
    at t.publicLog (file:////Applications/Visual Studio Code - Alpha.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:68:19740)
```

data.title: revert file when doing Git clean
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.10
- OS Version: windows 8.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. init git in project
2. edit a file save, and commit
3. edit the file and do not save
4. Go to Git view
5. on the file chose clean (git clean)

The editor should also preform a revert file action. there is no reason to keep the changes in memory but reverting on disk.

 As a side effect, when trying to save gives an error that the file on disk is newer and cannot save.

data.title: Exception when using --wait and killing the cli before the window closes
data.body:
Related to #4006
- VSCode alpha 18ebb4a4
- OS X

Steps:
1. Setup `code-alpha --wait` to be the git editor
2. Open Code Alpha, open the dev tools in that window
3. Run `git config --global -e`
4. Wait for new window to open
5. `Ctrl-C` in the terminal
6. Close the new window
7. The dev tools in the original window will show this error:

```
kill ESRCH: Error: kill ESRCH
    at exports._errnoException (util.js:837:11)
    at process.kill (node.js:791:15)
    at EventEmitter.<anonymous> (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Alpha.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-main/main.js:9:10190)
    at emitOne (events.js:82:20)
    at EventEmitter.emit (events.js:169:7)
    at e.onWindowClosed (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Alpha.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-main/main.js:8:19470)
    at BrowserWindow.<anonymous> (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Alpha.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-main/main.js:8:14609)
    at emitOne (events.js:77:13)
    at BrowserWindow.emit (events.js:169:7)
```

Nothing seems to be broken though. Just need a little `try catch` around that `kill`.

data.title: First F5 does not seem to have any effect in extension host debugging
data.body:
VS Code 0.10.12-alpha
- create a Hello World extension
- open in VS Code
- press F5

Observe: nothing happens
- press F5

Observe: extension host window appears
- reload window of the extension workspace (not the extension host window)
- press F5

Observe: nothing happens

data.title: Column select copy & paste
data.body:
- VSCode Version:  0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Select a region using column select (multiple lines)
2. Copy
3. open another editor (e.g. notepad)
4. Paste

Observe: you paste a single line. I would expect to paste as many lines as I have selected in the source

data.title: Windows: Pressing stop does not close extension development window in some cases
data.body:
I notice that pressing the stop button in debug no longer seems to close the extension host window, at least sometimes. Did something change here in the protocol?

I only see it sporadically so I wonder if this is some timing issue.

Also @weinand fyi

data.title: Can't deal with C# files(.cs)
data.body:
- VS Code Version:0.10.10
- OS Version:Windows 10 16586.164

Steps to Reproduce:

Can‘t Support C# files(.CS)
1. It tells you that “C# is  now an extension.Would you like to install it ?

2.I click Yes,but after the installation nothing happened.It still can’t support C# files.

3.I think there are some bugs  during the installation.

I‘m a college student in Shanghai，and I like VS Code very much.I think it's a cool editor,please make it better.

data.title: Opening output panel should flush buffer without delay
data.body:
I find it weird that opening the output channel appends the last output only after the 300ms delay. This makes it feel as if the output came in just at the time you open the panel. I suggest to just take whatever is in the buffer at that time and append it.

Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3926
